problem_text:
19.17. (Well-known problem). Suppose that G is a finitely presented group such that the set of first Betti numbers over all the finite index subgroups of G is unbounded above. (Here, the first Betti number is the maximum n for which there is a surjective homomorphism onto Zn.)
a) Must G have a finite index subgroup with a surjective homomorphism to a non-abelian free group?
b) Can G even be soluble?
J. O. Button
